column4: i love when your on the web and some popup that looks like a system message comes up saying 'you need a registry clean!' thats funny  to me ;) I think haha spamming bastards, I have no registry!
wrong
yeah it is so 10-days-old :)
2.6.11 packages are broken - do not use
so the kernel is not to be used at all?
indeed
so I can just use synaptic to remove it then right? also, will I benefit from a 2.6.10 k7 release then, since the default kernel isn't amd optomized?
depends
the ubuntu kernel packages update the grub config
okay thanks
have the linux-k7 package installed
installing that should clear up the error and make use of the nvidia drivers that are there?
that makes sure your linux-restricted-modules and linux-image are matching
so if I'm getting no module found for NVIDIA errors with that kernel this should fix it right?
the linux-k7 package did the trick, thanks ;)
in hoary the admin group is in the sudoers file
ah ok
haakonn stop the editor war...
yes, wait
you just need to reinstall grub afterwards
boot from a livecd and use gparted/qtparted

it's gui and pretty straight forward
